MC.content: the indivisibility of Lacan’s letter creates dogma
MC.linkedContent: the indivisibility of Lacan’s letter creates dogma

MC.content: why the letter, name, is divisible but still iterable (re-markable in its difference)
MC.linkedContent: why the letter, name, is divisible but still iterable (re-markable in its difference)

MC.content: mark beyond human language [letter still human?]
letter always arrives means the unconscious has no accidents, no internal chance [see p. 375 biogenetics no randomness, no bastardy]
MC.linkedContent: letter always arrives means the unconscious has no accidents, no internal chance [see p. 375 biogenetics no randomness, no bastardy]

PP.content: in Laws judge must introject, internalize the letter, grammata [tou Dephikou grammatos], into his soul; anamnesic dialectics, repetition of eidos, self-knowledge, self-mastery > a forgetting of childhood, exorcism of child, teaches child to speak
PP.linkedContent: in Laws judge must introject, internalize the letter, grammata [tou Dephikou grammatos], into his soul; anamnesic dialectics, repetition of eidos, self-knowledge, self-mastery > a forgetting of childhood, exorcism of child, teaches child to speak

PP.content: Plato uses letter, alphabet, for pedagogical ends > never thematizes law of difference made apparent, the irreducibility of structure & relation, of proportionality, w/in analogy
PP.linkedContent: Plato uses letter, alphabet, for pedagogical ends > never thematizes law of difference made apparent, the irreducibility of structure & relation, of proportionality, w/in analogy

WM.content: for Aristotle, brutes and humans both make sounds, but only humans make sounds that can become intelligible, meaningful, sounds that become letters
WM.linkedContent: for Aristotle, brutes and humans both make sounds, but only humans make sounds that can become intelligible, meaningful, sounds that become letters

WM.content: for Aristotle, the letter, the stoikheion, has no meaning in itself, but is capable of entering formation/composition of a phōnē sēmantikē, it is the atom of the voice (phōnē adiairetos)
WM.linkedContent: for Aristotle, the letter, the stoikheion, has no meaning in itself, but is capable of entering formation/composition of a phōnē sēmantikē, it is the atom of the voice (phōnē adiairetos)

ROP.content: divisibility of letter, truth w/out truth of deconstruction, distinguished both from das geistige Band [Hegel], & Heideggerian Versammlung > divisibility of letter undoes link of debt, symbolic, name of father (motifs qui lien et se lient au triangle ou au cercle de la réappropriation)
ROP.linkedContent: divisibility of letter, truth w/out truth of deconstruction, distinguished both from das geistige Band [Hegel], & Heideggerian Versammlung > divisibility of letter undoes link of debt, symbolic, name of father (motifs qui lien et se lient au triangle ou au cercle de la réappropriation)

ROP.content: Derrida frustrated that at colloquia no one ever goes into detail, swept away by voice, do w/out minutiae of letter (the micrological displacements where I incorrigibly persist in hoping things get decided—at a given moment, that’s never given)
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida frustrated that at colloquia no one ever goes into detail, swept away by voice, do w/out minutiae of letter (the micrological displacements where I incorrigibly persist in hoping things get decided—at a given moment, that’s never given)

ROP.content: to say “we” when all alone, after the death of the other, is a common phenomena of destinerrance, of the letter’s never returning, une dérive interne, to which we have to return
ROP.linkedContent: to say “we” when all alone, after the death of the other, is a common phenomena of destinerrance, of the letter’s never returning, une dérive interne, to which we have to return

ROP.content: “we” modality of with, with the other, as guest, host, or parasite, we is always said by a single person, taking advantage, the one signs for the other (at the home of; apud, avuec, avoc, apud hoc)
ROP.linkedContent: “we” modality of with, with the other, as guest, host, or parasite, we is always said by a single person, taking advantage, the one signs for the other (at the home of; apud, avuec, avoc, apud hoc)

ROP.content: idealism of the indivisibility of the letter, “the materiality of the signifier,” the place of the signifier
ROP.linkedContent: idealism of the indivisibility of the letter, “the materiality of the signifier,” the place of the signifier

ATIA.content: question of the animal, question of the letter
ATIA.linkedContent: question of the animal, question of the letter

PS.content: acc. Artaud, letter is always stolen, because always open, never leads from subject to subject; autonomy of signifier as letter’s historicity, my vouloir-dire is submissive
PS.linkedContent: acc. Artaud, letter is always stolen, because always open, never leads from subject to subject; autonomy of signifier as letter’s historicity, my vouloir-dire is submissive

PS.content: Derrida shows in Nietzsche & Hölderlin an equation btwn dancing, standing upright, and the work itself
PS.linkedContent: Derrida shows in Nietzsche & Hölderlin an equation btwn dancing, standing upright, and the work itself

PS.content: but, unlike Artaud, they treat erection metaphorically, it doesn’t exile itself into the work, expatriate itself to sovereignty of speech/writing, uprightness of letter, the tip of the pen
PS.linkedContent: but, unlike Artaud, they treat erection metaphorically, it doesn’t exile itself into the work, expatriate itself to sovereignty of speech/writing, uprightness of letter, the tip of the pen

PS.content: does Nietzsche question relation of grammatical security & uprightness of letter?
PS.linkedContent: does Nietzsche question relation of grammatical security & uprightness of letter?

PS.content: Heidegger foretells this relationship: Greeks interpret language visually, as grammata, in writing language comes to stand (paradoxically, this confirms disdain of writing in Phaedrus)
PS.linkedContent: Heidegger foretells this relationship: Greeks interpret language visually, as grammata, in writing language comes to stand (paradoxically, this confirms disdain of writing in Phaedrus)

PS.content: Artaud advocates the stigmata, the wound, not the tattoo (still too much liberated letter)
PS.linkedContent: Artaud advocates the stigmata, the wound, not the tattoo (still too much liberated letter)

FS.content: structuralist demand for flat/horizontal, letter of the Law, can’t bear volume, lability
FS.linkedContent: structuralist demand for flat/horizontal, letter of the Law, can’t bear volume, lability

DIF.content: if Saussure’s opposition speech/language is rigorous, differance would be play of differences w/in language & relation of speech/language, the detour, the silent promise I must make to speak (but differance forbids this essential dissociation: archi-writing before the letter))
DIF.linkedContent: if Saussure’s opposition speech/language is rigorous, differance would be play of differences w/in language & relation of speech/language, the detour, the silent promise I must make to speak (but differance forbids this essential dissociation: archi-writing before the letter))

REST.content: shoe, like letter, does not always arrive at its destination: condition of revenance [Derrida replaces “letter” w/ “shoe,” quoting a passage from FV]
REST.linkedContent: shoe, like letter, does not always arrive at its destination: condition of revenance [Derrida replaces “letter” w/ “shoe,” quoting a passage from FV]

REST.content: “useless hermeticism [Artaud]” of crypted remainder, secret already legible, separation already in the word, the letter, the pair > opening of secret
REST.linkedContent: “useless hermeticism [Artaud]” of crypted remainder, secret already legible, separation already in the word, the letter, the pair > opening of secret

TR.content: resistance of letter (force of resistance w/out material substance) affects body: dissociative, dismembering, disseminating [materiality w/out matter, formality w/out form]
TR.linkedContent: resistance of letter (force of resistance w/out material substance) affects body: dissociative, dismembering, disseminating [materiality w/out matter, formality w/out form]

TR.content: textual event inseparable from formal materiality of the letter
TR.linkedContent: textual event inseparable from formal materiality of the letter

TR.content: notion of grammar understood acc. trivium/quadrivium (see Warminski), but also as a machine of the letter (gramma), letter machine, writing machine
TR.linkedContent: notion of grammar understood acc. trivium/quadrivium (see Warminski), but also as a machine of the letter (gramma), letter machine, writing machine

EJQB.content: nemein: common root of division, naming, nomadism > nomadic Jew struck by infinity & the letter in the desert
EJQB.linkedContent: nemein: common root of division, naming, nomadism > nomadic Jew struck by infinity & the letter in the desert

EJQB.content: absence: letter’s ether & respiration (can’t be reduced by letter)
EJQB.linkedContent: absence: letter’s ether & respiration (can’t be reduced by letter)

EJQB.content: letter (separation & limit), liberation of meaning from aphoristic solitude
EJQB.linkedContent: letter (separation & limit), liberation of meaning from aphoristic solitude

EJQB.content: signifying absence/separation, letter lives as aphorism, it is solitude, articulates solitude: letter of law can’t be outside difference, can’t end interruption, distance, (non)relation to other
EJQB.linkedContent: signifying absence/separation, letter lives as aphorism, it is solitude, articulates solitude: letter of law can’t be outside difference, can’t end interruption, distance, (non)relation to other

EJQB.content: animality of letter assumes forms of letter’s desire, anxiety, solitude [cf. p. 73 metaphor is this animality?]
EJQB.linkedContent: animality of letter assumes forms of letter’s desire, anxiety, solitude [cf. p. 73 metaphor is this animality?]

EJQB.content: Jew is split btwn 2 dimensions of letter: 1) allegory (no history, abstract universalism, cold skin of concept) 2) literality (empirical, actualized history, too warm flesh)
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew is split btwn 2 dimensions of letter: 1) allegory (no history, abstract universalism, cold skin of concept) 2) literality (empirical, actualized history, too warm flesh)

EL.content: try as best one can to do an internal reading (stay as close to letter as possible) > but simple event of name breaches supposed interiority of text (pure internal reading impossible)
EL.linkedContent: try as best one can to do an internal reading (stay as close to letter as possible) > but simple event of name breaches supposed interiority of text (pure internal reading impossible)

+R.content: each letter [re: Adami’s drawing] has the same arched, slightly in-curved rigidity, supple flexion of an erect phallus—fish btwn life/death
+R.linkedContent: each letter [re: Adami’s drawing] has the same arched, slightly in-curved rigidity, supple flexion of an erect phallus—fish btwn life/death

+R.content: plus d’air, plus r [+R]; each letter, especially gl: re-marks the slippery surface, angled word, edge of tomb, hooked (crochue) signature > each letter, bit or piece of word (mors ou morceau de mot) written w/ 2 hands, twice two hands, on each page
+R.linkedContent: plus d’air, plus r [+R]; each letter, especially gl: re-marks the slippery surface, angled word, edge of tomb, hooked (crochue) signature > each letter, bit or piece of word (mors ou morceau de mot) written w/ 2 hands, twice two hands, on each page

TN.content: letter (touchable), spirit (untouchable), Jews/Christians—who touches more? Hegel’s hardness of Jews

OG.content: Rousseau: to “judge genius” from books is like “painting a man’s portrait from his corpse”; Derrida: writing in the common sense is the dead letter, exhausts life, carrier of death
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: to “judge genius” from books is like “painting a man’s portrait from his corpse”; Derrida: writing in the common sense is the dead letter, exhausts life, carrier of death

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, return to inalienable immediacy of self-possession (jouissance de soi), unrepresentable sovereignty—the end of written law > there is a social contract before writing, but always threatened by letter
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, return to inalienable immediacy of self-possession (jouissance de soi), unrepresentable sovereignty—the end of written law > there is a social contract before writing, but always threatened by letter

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, Leibniz’s pure algebra, universal writing of science, total break from langue parlée, would be absolute evil, alienation > Rousseau: “la lettre tue”
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, Leibniz’s pure algebra, universal writing of science, total break from langue parlée, would be absolute evil, alienation > Rousseau: “la lettre tue”

SPEC.content: postal relay (relais) makes it possible for letter not to arrive, divides structure of letter from outset (d’entrée), neither relay nor analysis if letter were indivisible & always arrived
SPEC.linkedContent: postal relay (relais) makes it possible for letter not to arrive, divides structure of letter from outset (d’entrée), neither relay nor analysis if letter were indivisible & always arrived

FV.content: for Lacan, letter is held—never possessed
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, letter is held—never possessed

FV.content: letter has no proper meaning, volante, volée; Lacan claims the letter isn’t content w/ having meaning > Derrida intends to show that w/ Lacan the letter is content to have one meaning, and one alone
FV.linkedContent: letter has no proper meaning, volante, volée; Lacan claims the letter isn’t content w/ having meaning > Derrida intends to show that w/ Lacan the letter is content to have one meaning, and one alone

FV.content: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier

FV.content: [Derrida’s syntactical deconstruction of Lacan] re: letter, manque à sa place [missing from its place] becomes manque a sa place [lack has its place]
FV.linkedContent: [Derrida’s syntactical deconstruction of Lacan] re: letter, manque à sa place [missing from its place] becomes manque a sa place [lack has its place]

FV.content: “Seminar” insists on topos, single proper itinerary of letter, if meaning [in the general sense] is indifferent to letter, meaning of the letter is not, meaning of letter as truth itself
FV.linkedContent: “Seminar” insists on topos, single proper itinerary of letter, if meaning [in the general sense] is indifferent to letter, meaning of the letter is not, meaning of letter as truth itself

FV.content: not naive topology but still a topos, Heideggerian-like veiled/unveiled castration placed at the hole (trou) of the woman, letter comes back to Being, to the nothing that is the opening btwn woman’s legs (Queen)
FV.linkedContent: not naive topology but still a topos, Heideggerian-like veiled/unveiled castration placed at the hole (trou) of the woman, letter comes back to Being, to the nothing that is the opening btwn woman’s legs (Queen)

FV.content: letter found “in” the text which escapes, from 4th side, eyes of Dupin/analyst [letter not found in sealed interior of Poe’s tale, not assignable lack, definable hole]
FV.linkedContent: letter found “in” the text which escapes, from 4th side, eyes of Dupin/analyst [letter not found in sealed interior of Poe’s tale, not assignable lack, definable hole]

FV.content: the text The Purloined Letter: the open, the very open, letter that is fiction
FV.linkedContent: the text The Purloined Letter: the open, the very open, letter that is fiction

FV.content: for Derrida, letter can always not arrive > Lacan’s symbolic, Lacan’s castration, protects letter from its divisibility/fragmentation
FV.linkedContent: for Derrida, letter can always not arrive > Lacan’s symbolic, Lacan’s castration, protects letter from its divisibility/fragmentation

FV.content: Lacan (as Dupin) knows how to return to letter of Freud, knows how to find it where it is found (se trouve) for purposes of restitution
FV.linkedContent: Lacan (as Dupin) knows how to return to letter of Freud, knows how to find it where it is found (se trouve) for purposes of restitution

FV.content: [Lacan on properly inheriting, following the letter of Freud]
FV.linkedContent: [Lacan on properly inheriting, following the letter of Freud]

FV.content: Dupin’s feminization: possess the letter [?] > letter has one place, occupied by all those who possess it
FV.linkedContent: Dupin’s feminization: possess the letter [?] > letter has one place, occupied by all those who possess it

FV.content: [proper] address of letter: law that binds King & Queen
FV.linkedContent: [proper] address of letter: law that binds King & Queen

FV.content: there are only ostriches, the more one presents one’s rear, the more one is master: can’t avoid being plucked (laisser plumer)
FV.linkedContent: there are only ostriches, the more one presents one’s rear, the more one is master: can’t avoid being plucked (laisser plumer)

FV.content: for Lacan, letter’s destiny is arrival at destination
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, letter’s destiny is arrival at destination

FV.content: circulation, always circulation of truth: toward truth, cause & effect of circle, causa sui, proper course (trajet) and destiny of letter > truth as cause (Ursache)
FV.linkedContent: circulation, always circulation of truth: toward truth, cause & effect of circle, causa sui, proper course (trajet) and destiny of letter > truth as cause (Ursache)

FV.content: for signifier to be kept (pour que le signifiant se garde) in its letter—no partition (if divisible, always can be lost en route) > materiality—indivisibility—idealization—point de capiton (staples signifier to signified) [?]: Lacan determines letter (no matter what he says) at point of its meaning (ideality): letter escapes partition, movement [no wonder he calls this “materiality” “odd”]
FV.linkedContent: for signifier to be kept (pour que le signifiant se garde) in its letter—no partition (if divisible, always can be lost en route) > materiality—indivisibility—idealization—point de capiton (staples signifier to signified) [?]: Lacan determines letter (no matter what he says) at point of its meaning (ideality): letter escapes partition, movement [no wonder he calls this “materiality” “odd”]

FV.content: [phonematic limitation of letter, phonē spared divisibility] voice: spontaneous self-presence one can retain (garder) w/out paper, w/out envelope, always available (disponible) > Lacan’s not attentive to writing w/in the voice, before the letter
FV.linkedContent: [phonematic limitation of letter, phonē spared divisibility] voice: spontaneous self-presence one can retain (garder) w/out paper, w/out envelope, always available (disponible) > Lacan’s not attentive to writing w/in the voice, before the letter

FV.content: sheltered (à l’abri) from disseminating threat/power in OG, agency of Lacan’s letter is the relève of writing in system of speech
FV.linkedContent: sheltered (à l’abri) from disseminating threat/power in OG, agency of Lacan’s letter is the relève of writing in system of speech

FV.content: Lacan advocates reconciliation (Versohnung), re: reintegration [of letter?]
FV.linkedContent: Lacan advocates reconciliation (Versohnung), re: reintegration [of letter?]

FV.content: when letter isn’t allergic to partition, linguistic unit (le sème) “phallus” wanders, begins by disseminating, not even disseminating itself [baby daddy]
FV.linkedContent: when letter isn’t allergic to partition, linguistic unit (le sème) “phallus” wanders, begins by disseminating, not even disseminating itself [baby daddy]

FV.content: even when letter arrives, its capacity not to arrive torments it, affects “subject,” “character,” “position” [w/ divisibility]
FV.linkedContent: even when letter arrives, its capacity not to arrive torments it, affects “subject,” “character,” “position” [w/ divisibility]

FV.content: meaning of letter not important for Lacan? false! no one would worry about it if it didn’t have a determined meaning > meaning of letter for Lacan: betrayal of a pact
FV.linkedContent: meaning of letter not important for Lacan? false! no one would worry about it if it didn’t have a determined meaning > meaning of letter for Lacan: betrayal of a pact

FV.content: mise en abyme of title [The Purloined…]: the text is the object
FV.linkedContent: mise en abyme of title [The Purloined…]: the text is the object
